caption.p: Specificity of the DENV LSPR-Nanosensors. Individual sensors were incubated with human flavivirus-negative serum (blue lines), human Saint Louis encephalitis virus-positive serum (SLEV, red lines), or human Yellow Fever virus-positive serum (YFV, green lines). Specific sera were pooled and diluted in 1:10,000 rations. ( A, B) Nanosensor GNR-DENV1E, ( C, D) Nanosensor GNR-DENV2E, ( E, F) Nanosensor GNR-DEN3E and ( G, H) Nanosensor GNR-DENV4E. Reads were obtained between 750 and 900 nm wavelength range (graphs in A, C, E, G). Relative shifts on the region of zero of the derivative curves for each serum are shown below each graph (graphs in B, D, F, H). The equipment wavelength accuracy is ± 3 nm and shifts equal or higher than 5 nm were considered significant. Shifts are related to the sensors suspended in 10 mM phosphate buffer with no sera added. Samples from sera banks depicted on Tables S1 and S2 (supplementary material) were used in this experiment.
